newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Trading on Dhaka bourse suspended for second day.
newsitem.headline: Trading on Dhaka bourse suspended for second day.

text.p: Trading on Dhaka Stock Exchange was suspended for a second day on Monday as hundreds of investors, angered by losses due to a lingering market bearishness, continued their demonstration.
"Unceratinty has gripped the capital market as the small investors continued to agitate despite the government's efforts to bring back confidence," said one broker.
Finance Minister S.A.M.S. Kibria on Sunday asked the state-owned Investment Corporation of Bangladesh (ICB) to extend support to the market and prevent any further slide.
"Nobody could turn up for trading," said a securityman at the DSE building. "I don't know when the deadlock will be over," said another broker.
"We are ready to operate, but could not enter the building," the broker said.
The DSE all share price index closed 48.8 points or 1.83 percent down at 2,618.3 on Saturday. Friday is the weekend in Moslem Bangladesh.
